channel.title: Need help again lol
channel.description:
ok i am trying to use radialroadwalk.
this function here
RadialWalk(TheColor: Integer; StartRadial, EndRadial: Integer; Radius: Integer; Xmod, Ymod: Integer): Boolean;
an i set it out like so
RadialRoadWalk(6710894, 180, 6842736, 45, -2, 2);
an it works fine how ever can someone please help me so it picks a new road colour every time as it cant find the colour once i log in an out. so it puts the new colour it finds in the place the colour is ment to be.
thanks for reading this any how is appreciated

item.title: Need help again lol
item.dc:creator: @N4TH4N N4TH4N
item.description:
@N4TH4N wrote:

RadialRoadWalk(6710894, 180, 6842736, 45, -2, 2);

Your end radial is outside the range, the range is 0-1440

Read full topic

item.title: Need help again lol
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Just look at your other thread! http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,46734.msg576855.html#msg576855

Also, RadialRoadWalk and LinearRoadWalk are the only walkers that use colour that will be able to work over Loading screens, and Logging in and out. Hoever, if you are walking on something else, you can just use the plain RadialWalk. RadialRoadWalk will pick the colours throughtout it’s running, but have the script pick the first RoadColor using Bitmaps in your first Login.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help again lol
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Well you’ll need an auto-color procedure. Sometimes symbols can be of use, if they’re in the same spot all of the time, but that’s only true for some symbols.

There’s a couple of things you can do, one option is searching each pixel of the minimap for a certain color using a tolerance, or you could search a box within the minimap for a certain color. If you need more help, just ask.

Read full topic
